name: Half-elven Dragon Shape Zen Arcane Archer (Druid 24 / AA 13 / Bard 3)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi everyone

I thought I would try to make a build, where the poor neglected half-elf is the most favourable.

A challenging quest I know, perhaps even more challenging than the half-orc best race for build quest, but I believe this build is a noble candidate for such a challenge.

This is a Half-elven Dragon Shape Zen Arcane Archer. Undispellable buffs (apart from Mord's/Breaches). Base AB 46. Full Druid spell book plus SF/GSF/ESF Conjuration for some lovely grease/stonehold/SoV spam. 

Pretty simple, cast spells to hold em in place. Then Shoot'em with high AB.

If they are spell resistant and come up close, turn into a Bear / Elder Water Elemental / Dragon and hit em. With the Full BAB progression from Arcane Archer and a toughness feat, it's gonna be a pretty tough dragon you turn into.

No Monk sadly for shapes 

Bard for a good old discipline /tumble / UMD skill dump. I've taken Taunt as well, so you can have a 'Taunting' Dragon to lower your opponents AC so you can hit em more often. 

Comments / suggestions appreciated. I could go longbow but the server I play has nice shortbows available. In other environments Longbow would be more favourable.
